topics.body:
*I know I'm late and you all have started talking about stuff other than manga and anime, but I had to take care of something before I could finish typing this out*

You know I always wondered how the fuck shows like Naruto or DBZ even became popular in the first place and then the mangagate shit happened.

If you're wondering what this has to do with anything basically in japan there's a mild drama storm that is a offshoot of the gamergate thing going on; don't worry it's only incidentally related cause gamergate is what set off mangagate, but that's where the relation ends.  Basically otakus in Japan are tired of large scale companies threatening to pull advertising dollars if they receive bad press and that they constantly are forced to push positive press meaning those that have more money get more positive attention and such.

It's more like the dorito pope thing than what's currently going on cause the manga industry isn't yelling at anyone for being criticisized, they're not yelling racial slurs at those criticisizing them or anything; they're just a bunch of sell outs and they are addressing the concerns of people.

Mangagate summarized in one image:
!http://i1.kym-cdn.com/photos/images/original/000/757/263/193.jpg!

Anyways the reason why most of everyone here hasn't heard of it is that it's been really civil.  Also the reason why I bring this up is that looking at mangagate I *HIGHLY* have to doubt any shonen manga or anime(yes I know shonen is a demographic before you get your panties in a bunch) is going to fill the void left by Naruto because the changes going on right now behind the scenes will make it impossible for something like Naruto to happen again; the reason being is that Naruto, DBZ and such became popular through unethical business practices and now the manga and anime industry is changing business practice wise cause of the concerns of watchers so the way those franchises became popular are completely shut out for new series now.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a892276368727049ea0100#post_54a892276368727049ea0100
If we're talking about in Japan, Dragonball became popular because there was nothing else quite like it at the time.  (No Idea how Z exploded in popularity in america though.)

Also, Hokuto no Ken was nothing like Dragon Ball. (At least the early stuff)

Edit: I do admit that if it wasn't for the Dr. Slump crossover, People probably woudn't have even noticed it. (Though people stuck with it because it was unique and good)
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a8930063687238cd570600#post_54a8930063687238cd570600
Why did americans like DBZ anyhow?

Anyways my point in a nutshell is basically the changes going on right now in the anime industry is:
Beforehand:
"We're paying advertising dollars for your site so give us positive reviews"
Mangagate in a nutshell, "That's unethical business practices"
"You know what; you're right.  We'll change our business practices"

I wouldn't even call mangagate a shitstorm personally cause it's just a bunch of suits getting caught being naughty and then them immediately realizing not to piss off their consumers.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a8963b63687230650e0000#post_54a8963b63687230650e0000
I think the same thing applies, There was nothing quite like it on the airwaves. (For example. In japan, Golion fell flat On its face because there were lots of other Robot anime that were just like it if not better, Voltron was a huge success because it was the only mecha show available on U.S. Airwaves at the time)
